lines.text:
[Shaft is asking the butler about Brewster]
How tall was he?
Oh, short. Very short, like you.
I'm six one, Milhouse.
You are? I'm five nine and you look shorter than me.
You're standing on the steps.
Oh. So I am.
Alright, where were you when you interviewed him?
Here. Right here, where we are.
You were up there and he was down here. Is that right?
I think so.
Let's see, those steps are about eight inches, so that means if he was six foot one he would have looked to you to be about 16 inches shorter. About four nine.
Right. Under five feet. Short. Only I think I was down here.
[He steps down to the floor]
And he was there.
[Shaft climbs up one step]
What the hell would he be doing up here?
Well, he was short, like I said, and maybe it made him feel better.

[Shaft sits on the step]
Alright, he was up here and you were down there. Is that right?
Right.
And he looked to you to be about four foot nine?
That's right, short.
Jesus Christ, Milhouse, if he was four foot nine and he was standing on sixteen inches of steps that'd make him only three foot five.
That's right. He was short like you.
I forgot the opening line.

throwing Brewster, with his expensive camera, into some bushes]
Get over in there!

[Holding up a small cylindrical paper object]
You know what this is?
A poorly rolled cigarette.

It's a marijuana cigarette. It's dope. It's dope I picked up after I saw you drop it outta' your pocket. You give me that camera and we'll forget this little matter. If ya' don't, it's one to ten. So take your pick.
Mister, one of us is crazy.
Oh, yeah?
[Pulls out his badge and holds it out]
"Breen." "Narcotics."
[a bird turd promptly splats on the badge]
There are times, Bernard, when a man works best alone. This is one of those times.
What did he mean by that?
I don't know, but it's something
I know birdshit when I see it! Now I suggest we drop this birdshit shit and settle down to some old-fashioned policework!
